title: Understanding Spontaneity
text: A reaction's spontaneity at a given temperature depends on the Gibbs free energy change (∆G°). If ∆G° is greater than $$0$$, the reaction is non-spontaneous.

title: Relation of ∆G° and Temperature
text: Spontaneity is determined by the sign of ∆G°. At standard conditions, if ∆G° is positive, the reaction doesn't favor the formation of products.

title: Equation for ∆G°
text: The equation ∆G° $$=$$ ∆H° - T∆S° can provide insight. However, with a positive ∆G° at 298K, the reaction shows non-spontaneity at this temperature.
